WorkItem.Description: For some reason, there seems to be something wrong with the gems in the latest version (for Enhance).  It continues to make BOP jewelcrafter gems available for optimization even though they are not selected as available.  It is also giving strange rankings for gems based on DPS (e.g. if I selected yellow gems and sort by DPS, deadly monarch topaz shows as the highest dps gem; which is obviously not correct.)

Comments.Message: For BOP gems have you checked to make sure they are not enabled in the gemming templates?
The gem scores should be fixed by the thready safety fix.

Gem related, similar issue.

Equip Custom Gemming is only listing 8-10 gems when previous versions listed all available gems.  In many cases, best in slot gem is not even an option.  No filtering was chosen and all templates should have been active.  Specific example would be the +20exp gem to be applied to chest.
Did you not see the 20 other posts everywhere saying check your filters?

No, frankly I did not because there weren't any in the top 50 when I added my comment.  My apologies.

Since I didn't change the filtering before from previous versions, why would I expect a new one to be any different?

I did find the setting and corrected it.

The Gemming is killing me. I've gone through the columns, for some unknown reason, the gem templates have built-in templates that cannot be edited. The first one for my ret pally lists Bold Cardnal Ruby in EACH column. That tells RAWR that this RED gem can go into ANY socket, and sure enough when I run optimizer, it's slapping this gem into every blue and yellow socket it can find. I've turned off "make available to optimizer", add my own gemming, unchecked everything, engforce gemming, etc. I don't understand why they don't do a simple check to make sure the gem can fit into that socket, before they recommend it in the optimizer results.
Red gems CAN go into Blue sockets...

I guess what I mean, is that I wish the optimizer had an option to find the best gem without discarding/breaking the socket bonus. So if I had a blue socket, it would go through the green/blue/purple epics and find the best gem.
We intentionally don't have that because there would be no point, you would only be gimping your DPS.

True enough, I'm just saying that some players might want to use a piece for off spec too while buiting a second spec.  So a situation to lose 4 str  by not using an offset gem and gain 15 stam, might be better then to a DK atm if their off spec is tanking.
There is a batch optimizer for that (and it'd still be a terrible idea, almost certainly)

On the right side where it shows your upgrades: Gems > Slot Normal. Select you gems.

In almost every case (i do say almost), socket bonuses that are not from your best gem for DPS (Ap, ArP, Str, etc) are not better than gemming for the better gem and ignoring the bonus. If you reach a point to where 2 different color gems become very close in value, red and yellow, then Rawr will often select an orange gem with those stats in order to pick up the socket bonus. Blue sockets, ARE NOT, dps sockets. There is no stat on a blue gem (not including prismatic), that is worth it. So if your going for a purple, green, or even blue gem as a DPS, its half wasted.
